bitfield.description: Reflow pre-conditioning. Prepares device for reflow soldering. Write as 0 during normal operation.

bitenum.description: Set to 1 to trigger a BOR
Set to 1 to trigger a POR
Regulator remains on when going into LPM3 or LPM4
Regulator is turned off when going to LPM3 or LPM4. System enters LPM3.5 or LPM4.5, respectively.
High-side SVS (SVSH) is disabled in LPM2, LPM3, LPM4, LPM3.5, and LPM4.5. SVSH is always enabled in active mode, LPM0, and LPM1.

bitfield.description: Power Mode Selection. The two bits are used to select the power supply in multi power supply systems. A single power supply system is not affected by the bits. Reserved for future use.

bitenum.description: Reference voltage output is not ready to be used.
Reference voltage output is ready to be used
Buffered bandgap voltage is not ready to be used
Buffered bandgap voltage is ready to be used

bitfield.description: Reference voltage level select. Can be modified only when REFGENBUSY = 0.
Reference generator one-time trigger. If written with a 1, the generation of the variable reference voltage is started. When the reference voltage request is set, this bit is cleared by hardware.

bitenum.description: Generation of the reference voltage is started by writing 1 or by a hardware trigger

bitfield.description: Bandgap and bandgap buffer one-time trigger. If written with a 1, the generation of the buffered bandgap voltage is started. When the bandgap buffer voltage request is set, this bit is cleared by hardware.

bitenum.description: Generation of the bandgap voltage is started by writing 1 or by a hardware trigger

bitfield.description: PMM software brownout reset interrupt flag.

bitenum.description: Reset not due to reset pin

bitfield.description: Secondary Power interrupt flag. This bit only works in multi power supply systems. When the secondary power is ready to use, this bit is set., In single power supply systems, this bit does not work.

bitenum.description: Reset not due to wake-up from LPMx.5
Reset due to wake-up from LPMx.5

bitfield.description: PMM secondary power supply interrupt flag. Reserved for future multi power supply systems.
Primary Power interrupt flag. This bit only works in multi power supply systems. When the primary power is ready to use, this bit is set. In single power supply systems, this bit does not work

bitenum.description: LPMx.5 configuration is not locked and defaults to its reset condition.
LPMx.5 configuration remains locked. Pin state is held during LPMx.5 entry and exit.

bitfield.description: Reports or sets the LPM3.5 switch connection upon the switch mode set by LPM5SM. When this bit is set, the VLPM3.5 domain can accept full-speed read and write operation by CPU MCLK. If the switch is disconnected, all peripherals within this domain can only accept the operation no more than 40 kHz. In automatic mode (LPM5SM = 0), this bit represents the switch connection between Vcore and VLPM3.5. Any write to this bit has no effect. In manual mode (LPM5SM = 1), this bit can be fully read and written by software. When this bit is set, the switch connection between Vcore and VLPM3.5 is connected. Otherwise, the switch is disconnected.
Specifies the operation mode of the LPM3.5 switch.

bitenum.description: Automatic mode for LPM3.5 switch that the switch is fully handled by the circuitry during mode switch.
Manual mode for LPM3.5 switch that the switch is specified by LPM5SW bit setting in software.
